definition: social stratum below the level of ordinary people/untouchable/dalit (India caste)
inexpensive/lowly/despicable/(bound form) (humble) my
surname Min
the people/nationality/citizen

sentences.english: Before being liberated from slavery, these people had been scorned and used and treated as outcasts.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人脫離奴役前，飽受嘲弄利用，被視作賤民。

sentences.english: The second part is about the Special Dalits in Ming and Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，明清社會的特殊型賤民。

sentences.english: A small country with many foes cannot afford to become a pariah.
sentences.chinese: 有着衆多敵人的小國承擔不起變成被遺棄賤民的代價。

sentences.english: This effect remains until the Pariahs are eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 直到賤民的這一個效果殘餘物被除去。

sentences.english: Raj: Speaking of untouchables, I've got great news for you guys.
sentences.chinese: 說到賤民，我給你們帶來了好消息。

sentences.english: In India, we just call them untouchables.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，我們稱其爲賤民。

sentences.english: Dalits, in particular, were stuck in place, weighed down by centuries of discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 特別是賤民，多少個世紀以來，他們長期遭到歧視。

sentences.english: China is a pariah and would sell their own mother.
sentences.chinese: 中國就是個賣祖求榮的賤民嘛。

sentences.english: This must be the path of India's dalits, too.
sentences.chinese: 這肯定也是印度賤民需要走的路線。

sentences.english: They are illiterate women from India's Untouchable castes.
sentences.chinese: 他們是從印度的賤民種姓中來的文盲婦女。

sentences.english: Yoo sung-ryong offered to pariah free base, to encourage them for my country.
sentences.chinese: 柳成龍提出給賤民免賤，鼓勵他們爲國效力。

definition: to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to boast shamelessly/to talk big
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
ruler/those in power/the authorities
to boss people around (idiom)
rude and unreasonable
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
